intro: Gynandropsis ulei, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is known for its latex-like sap, which can be toxic and is used in traditional medicine. Gynandropsis ulei thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks.
